questions.text: Which of the following vascular resistances is the smallest

options.text: resistance of the intestinal vascular bed
total peripheral resistance
resistance of the renal vascular bed
resistance of the intracerebral vascular bed
resistance of the skin vessels

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.text: the resistance to flow is smaller in the capillary bed than in the arteriolar bed
the aorta is the segment of the circulatory system which has the greatest compliance
velocity decreases continuously from the aorta to the right atrium
due to the large cross sectional area, the capillary bed contains the largest fraction of blood volume
the tendency for the occurrence of turbulent flow increases when viscosity decreases
in a laminar flow, the highest velocities are measured in the axial stream

questions.text: Which of the following changes is the MOST effective in enhancing flow?

options.text: doubling the pressure gradient
doubling the radius of the tubing
reducing the viscosity to one half of the original
reducing the radius of the tubing to one half of the original
doubling the length of the tubing
reducing the length of the tubing to one half of the original
doubling the viscosity

questions.text: Blood flow tends to be turbulent when

options.text: white blood cell count increases (leukemia)
the caliber of the vessel increases
hematocrit decreases
flow velocity is low
the vessel is bent in a sharp angle
viscosity is low

questions.text: Total Peripheral Resistance (TPR) can be calculated by the following formula: (V1=aorta volume, V2= right atrial volume, CO= cardiac output, P1= aortal pressure, P2= right atrial pressure)

options.text: TPR=CO/P1-P2
TPR=V1-V2/CO
TPR=P1-P2/CO
TPR=V1-V2/P1-P2

questions.text: Which of the following vascular resistances is the smallest

options.text: resistance of the intracerebral vascular bed
total peripheral resistance
resistance of the pulmonary circulation
resistance of the intestinal vascular bed
resistance of the renal vascular bed

questions.text: As a function of vessel size, the resistance to fluid flow in a vessel is

options.text: inversely proportional to the square of the radius
directly proportional to the radius
inversely proportional to the fourth power of the radius
inversely proportional to the cube of the radius
directly proportional to the square of the radius
